title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 372.7 - Contributions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 372.7 - Contributions

State Regulations
(a) The trustee, upon the recommendation of the actuary, shall determine the required
contribution to pay plan benefits for each plan year. The required contribution
for each plan year shall be the total amount of benefits payable under sections
372.4, 372.5
and
372.6
of this Part to all
participants and their beneficiaries and such amount as determined by the
trustee to pay the administrative expenses of the plan and the employer's share
of any employment taxes on the benefits paid from the plan. (b) The required contribution as determined
by the trustee, upon the recommendation of the actuary, shall be paid into the
plan fund from an allocation of the employer contributions amounts paid
pursuant to section
23
of the Retirement and Social Security

Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
372.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
